structured.description: A Spring Boot application that uses the BCrypt password encryption algorithm to securely store and hash passwords. The `getPasswordEncoder()` method returns an instance of `BCryptPasswordEncoder`, which is used to encrypt and verify passwords.
structured.diagram:
digraph G {
    label="com.todo.FixMe"
    bgcolor="#151719"
    fontcolor="#ECEDED"
    splines=ortho
    fontname="Courier New"
    edge [color="#26de81"]
}

items.description: is a Spring Boot application that provides a BCryptPasswordEncoder instance for encrypting passwords using the BCrypt algorithm. The encoder is designed to handle strong password validation and is suitable for use in web applications.
items.name: MyHomeServiceApplication

items.description: starts a Spring application and runs the `MyHomeServiceApplication`.

params.name: args
params.description:
command-line arguments passed to the application when it is launched.

`String[] args`: This is an array of strings representing command-line arguments passed to the application.
